product_name: Bronze Plaque - Brown - Lugs with Studs
ml_tags: San Manuel Band of Mission Indians his people into the San Bernardino Valley. Long before we would be Before the arrival of European settlers. Before Santos Manuel led called the San Manuel Band of Mission Indians, our Tribe had a name. It echoed across the highlands, passes, valleys and mountains. It was not the name we adopted to survive a hostile world. It was not attached to any foreign concept, like “Mission Indians.” It was not given to us by others, so it could never be taken away. This name was our own, spoken in our language and rooted in our traditions. Today, its spirit lives on in all of us. It is forever part of our history. It is the heart and soul of our sovereignty. It is why we must reclaim our namesake for our ancestors and the generations to come. This is who we are. This is who we have always been. We are the People of the Pines. We are Yuhaaviatam. It was known among our Maara’yam people and to other tribes.
